text:
RT @BBC_Cumbria: The @EnvAgency says it's spent ¬£15m over the last five years, maintaining the county's flood defences.

Five years ago thi‚Ä¶

RT @RobGMacfarlane: A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
M‚Ä¶
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Massive hypocrites - the EA is about to bulldoze a chunk of Clifton Ings & Rawcliffe Meadows SSSI in York with plans to destroy more.

RT @tveitdal: Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened https://t.co/zLdRlYgqQ0
Witness describes damage to mile-‚Ä¶

@EnvAgency I did ask if the landowner had permission to do this work from you?
He's now replied you gave him permission?
Your response please?
Canalisation of a river increases the flow which just makes for bigger flooding problems for those downstream

https://t.co/5kiAODH5V7 https://t.co/J6bsWaZ8LR
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency He seems to have previous; converted a barn into a dwelling without Planning Permission.
@GeoffDa84684078 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Says an account created this week with no followers.

Given that @EnvAgency (with the collusion of @NEYorksNLincs) is poised to destroy an irreplaceable grassland SSSI in York, maybe these organisations could investigate themselves at the same time? https://t.co/oQ6smyizKl

The @EnvAgency says it's spent ¬£15m over the last five years, maintaining the county's flood defences.

Five years ago this weekend, 5,000 properties were flooded during Storm Desmond, and nearly 800 bridges and more than 180 miles of road were damaged or destroyed. https://t.co/tTvlx5B5CE

@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Think you better speak to the locals! They are all so relieved that this has been done due to years of flooding! The EA has done nothing about it! You need to look into this further before you criticise my response

We have a whole page dedicated to some of the #flood risk management schemes in the #NorthWest. Follow the link below for more information ‚¨áÔ∏è:
https://t.co/EA61nZzmS6 

#ReducingFloodRisk @EnvAgencyNW #NWEngland https://t.co/ief0lHQebA
